text: This week's @peltoncast previews a key Seahawks-Packers matchup on Thursday Night Football that seems to fit how Seattle wants to run offense (emphasis on run): https://t.co/8y3xd9ChVA
Ian Mahinmi just made his first career 3-pointer in his 556th game.
I really, honestly don't understand the obsession with Ben Simmons shooting 3s.
I don't know that I care about that much either, but the "coward" nonsense seems to be about willingness to take them rather than ability to make them. https://t.co/xiB4tXGzei
All things equal, more shooting is always better. But that's less important for ballhandlers and players with size, which describes Giannis as well as Ben Simmons. https://t.co/8ePctByMKf
He's likely a top-20 player now and age 22. There's not a lot of precedent for players peaking at age 22, so I think it's likely he develops into a top-10 player at minimum. https://t.co/OnRcGeg5tX
With the Spurs down 24 in the fourth quarter at Phoenix, Gregg Popovich has called three timeouts in a minute and a half of game time.
Took a look at how good the 2019-20 Warriors might be without Kevin Durant to help answer the question of how important he is to their future: https://t.co/x6XQGV3Jbk (ESPN+)
Carsen Edwards gets buckets.

Ian Eagle: "What do you think has to change here for Washington moving forward?"
Richard Jefferson, not waiting a beat: "Personnel"
Tonight's first half is what they show Bucks fans in the Bad Place and the third quarter is what they show Bucks fans in the Good Place.
Per @bball_ref, the largest margin of victory ever for a team that trailed by at least 18 at halftime was 20 points by Miami over Houston in November 2015. @RyanRuocco
Bucks fell one short, winning 123-104 -- a mere 37-point swing in the second half. https://t.co/BZ5o1v0yoB

Lakers now 8-7, same as the 2011 Heat and 2015 Cavaliers through their first 15 games with LeBron James. Big difference in terms of point differential, though.

2011 Heat: +6.8 ppg (tied for fourth best in NBA history among 8-7 teams)
2015 Cavaliers: +3.9
2019 Lakers: +0.3
Hopefully this year it won't take four injuries to get Kemba Walker on the All-Star team.
Not having a backup PG capable of replacing Russell Westbrook was a big risk for the Thunder. This year's strategy is Schroder.
